fields.description: fix it
fields.summary: source field is not entered

fields.description: When starting Sourcetree, it will often ask to delete spell checker dictionary files. I'm assuming Sourcetree creates these as well. It should be Sourcetree's responsibility to delete these instead of the user's, since Sourcetree knows which files it created.
fields.summary: Sourcetree should delete its own dictionary files instead of making the user responsible

fields.description:
When pulling from repository, Git reports Http Request Exception.

Doesn't affect very old versions (tried with 2.1.10).
fields.summary: Http Request Exception when pulling

fields.description:
When you drag some folder on FS (git repository) and drop it into some group in Source Tree it is placed in root instead of group.

View the video for the reference: [https://youtu.be/Po0OreFAhbE]
fields.summary: Drag and Drop works incorrectly when adding local git repository into group folder

fields.description:
Sometimes, when big GIT repo is loading tree there is white color background in tree window.

Steps to reproduce:
 * click Commit button
 * click branch i the left panel REMOTES/origin/[some branch name]

If the repository is big enough loading tree flashes with white color.

I think ST caches tree, because not every time this can be reproduced.

First time yes, than not all the time.

Maybe there is more than one loader in ST. Loading tree, next 300 commits, I dont't know. Developers should know.
fields.summary: Dark Theme: not working when loading/refreshing tree (ST 3.2.4)

fields.description:
Steps for reproducing:
 # Go to "Options" -> "Network", and set the proxy settings to "Use default operating system settings".
 # Go to Windows proxy settings, and disable the manual proxy connection.

 

Actual Result:

SourceTree will still use the configured proxy settings, even though these are disabled in Windows.

 

Expected Result:

SourceTree should detect the proxy connection is disabled in Windows settings, and don't try to use the proxy connection.
fields.summary: SourceTree doesn't seem to check proxy connection status

fields.description: Please check the installation file as virustotal.com is reporting that this file has a Trojan installed on it.
fields.summary: SourceTree installation file for windows with Trojan.Shelma!

fields.description:
Hi There,

 I am getting a Login windows continuesly while trying to clone a Repo (repo is owned by myself).

i tried with putting email address and changing the  password , but no luck 

!image-2019-07-25-15-23-44-143.png!

 

!image-2019-07-25-15-24-06-302.png!
fields.summary: Source tree keeps asking the credentials

fields.description:
Application deselects unstaged files.

Steps to reproduce:
 # Make changes in some files
 # Switch to SourceTree. Choose Tree view mode. Select unstage file.
 # Switch to another application and then back to SourceTree.
 ## Sometimes deselection happens even without switching to other application which is quite annoying.
 # SourceTree will deselect your file

Expected behavior:
 * Selected file doesn't get unselected

It happens only in tree mode. Flat list modes works as expected.
fields.summary: Deselection of unstaged file(s) in tree view mode

fields.description: Would you please add a theme with dark colors? Working with the text based interface with a white background is not easy. A theme with dark colors, would make the interface much easier on the eyes.
fields.summary: Dark colored theme

fields.description:
Hello

Today I install the Sourcetree version 3.2.4. (and some days ago I install the version 3.2.2)

When I desire to select one remote repository, I do not see it.

Actually we have 143 repositories and more than 500 projects stored in a remote GIT-Bitbucket server. But only 35 remote repository are shown with some

I can resfresh the list, but I can not even found the desired repository…

I see two solutions :
 # you write the searched repository and by clicking "refresh" it looks in every projects, not only on the displayed list
 # in the option menu, in sheet GIT, implement a new box where you can chose the projects (not only one) you work with, so it will reduce the number of repositories and you can select a project to work with.

Could you please solve this problem ?

Thanks

Best regards

Cédric

 

PS: I create already one issue, but I can not change the relase. It is the SRCTREEWIN-12146
fields.summary: Problem by searching remote repository

fields.description:
We have installed Sourcetree Enterprise 2.6.10. When we are browsing for repositories to clone on the remote environment ( ours is a on-premise Bitbucket server) we do not get all our repositories. It seems like that only the top 30-35 alphabetically ordered repositories in a Bitbucket project environment are found.

We suspect that the results from query to bitbucket are abbreviated. Is this a setting or configuration issue?

Our Users report that previous non Enterprise Sourcetree did and do find all repositories.
fields.summary: Enterprise Sourcetree does not get all repositories from on premise Bitbucket Server

fields.description:
When multiple instances of LogView are open, resizing one window updates the size of the other.

To Reproduce:
 # Open a repository, with committed changes.
 # Select a commit in the history with 2 or more updated files.
 # Select one file from the commit, and 'Log History'.
 # Select another file from the commit, and 'Log History'.
 # Ensure windows aren't maximised, and place such that they don't entirely occlude each other.
 # Resize one window.

Note that as this window resizes, so too does the other window. This can be replicated with N Windows.

Maximise is also affected.
fields.summary: Size of LogView Window is Coupled to All Instances

fields.description:
While the 1st of SourceTree the User is asked for the URL to the Bitbucket-Servier and his Login-Credentials.

Source did not accept the correct data. We have to
 * install Sourcetree 2.6
 * start Sourcetree 2.6, there the URL and the Login-Credentials are accepted
 * de-install Sourcetree 2.6
 * Install Sourcetree 3.1.2
 * Start Sourcetree 3.1.2 and the Connection to Bitbucket-Server is automatically set

 

What we expect:

Install Sourcetree 3.1.2 without "pre-install" Version 2.6
fields.summary: Install Enterprise Release 3: Unable to connect to Bitbucket Server

fields.description:
During the setup i am required to complete a 1 time registration by logging into either:
 * Bitbucket Server
 * Bitbucket

 

I select Bitbucket and my default browser (Chrome) opens and i login using my details, i am then redirected to the dashboard where i can then use the site normally.

 

The problem is the setup UI is still "Waiting for login to finish..."

 

I have now discovered that this issue only effects users that have set the browser to clear all data on exist, so are not logged in when the Setup launches the browser.

 

So if you are already logged in, in your browser the process works and you are presented with the consent form and the setup completes as expected.
fields.summary: Setup "Waiting for login to finish..."
Pinned icon in Windows is not being used when app launches, and app has blank page icon as the working "identifier" for when the app is open

fields.description:
Doing a merge that has conflicts so there is an auto generated merge conflicts comment.

Type some additional comments in the comments box.

Change a monitored file.

SourceTree will show a spinner while updating information about the updated file

Once the spinner is gone, and the changed file analysed, the comment has been reverted to the auto generated one.
fields.summary: Comments Reverting on file changed

fields.description:
Sourcetree has randomly started crashing when trying to open certain repositories, which previously worked fine, usually after a commit. I can't find anything wrong with the repos, and several other repos are still working and committing fine, even though they have the exact same setup and are stored in the same Bitbucket account. I've tried every solution I could find on Google, including deleting temp files and re-installing - nothing works. Used to just be one repo, now three. Please help, Sourcetree is gradually becoming un-usable.

 

I'm on Windows 10 and everything is the latest version. When I open Sourcetree it's fine, but when I try to open one of the affected repositories from the main list it opens it and then stops responding. I have to kill the process in order to get it to close.
fields.summary: Crashes when opening certain repositories.

fields.description:
Often I cannot resize between the commit message and the file diff.

See screenshot below:

!image-2019-07-08-09-44-14-606.png!

This is frustrating because of the amount of empty space that is being wasted on the left when often the changes in the file on the right are cut off.

Usually I can get it to work by changing which commit I am looking at several times until I find one that will let me resize it, but that doesn't always work.
fields.summary: Resizing between commit and diff does not work most of the time.

fields.description:
If the Sourcetree window is on a secondary monitor, the text cursor doesn't appear in text boxes. The textbox still receives input, and the cursor can still be moved around with the arrow keys or mouse, but the visual doesn't appear. 
!image-2019-07-05-14-23-10-172.png|width=526,height=92!

!image-2019-07-05-14-23-43-541.png!
fields.summary: cursor doesn't show up in textbox when sourcetree isn't in primary monitor

fields.description:
Hello, when I select a unstaged file called custom.css the program crashes, this does it everytime, I renamed the file and it seems to work perfectly after..

 

Before clicking:

!image-2019-07-03-10-19-55-965.png|width=514,height=226!

 

After clicking on custom.css:

!image-2019-07-03-10-21-52-029.png|width=747,height=594!
fields.summary: Crash when selecting a CSS file

fields.description:
When resizing the sourcetree window so much that the diff view is so small it becomes scrollable, the red and green background colors in the diff view isn't stretching to the end of the scrollable content. See attached image.

 

!image-2019-07-03-08-42-51-109.png!
fields.summary: Diff view does not fill up diff-colors if the view is scrollable

fields.description:
After renaming the repo projects in the Local repositories screen (press F2 on a repo and type a new name) the app will correctly change the tabs for any open projects to show the new name.

If you close and re-open source tree the tabs will show the original name of the repo instead of the new name.
fields.summary: Repo tabs do not show correct name

fields.description: I have already reported my issue in SRCTREE-6765. Raising the same again with enterprise support license to get this more priority and attention.
fields.summary: Bug same as SRCTREE-6765

fields.description:
# Open SourceTree with opened repository tab
 # Press Ctrl+Tab
fields.summary: application crashes when press Ctrl-Tab

fields.description:
Open «Железнодорожные билеты»
Press “Ещё”
Press “E-mail booking@uz.gov.ua”
"Expected Result” proposal for the transition to writing a letter
“Actual Result” page remains as it is
fields.summary: E-mail button does not give results

fields.description: Would you please add a theme with dark colors? Working with the text based interface with a white background is not easy. A theme with dark colors, would make the interface much easier on the eyes.
fields.summary: Dark colored theme

fields.description: When displaying file differences, lines are highlighted with red/green background color to indicate changes. In cases where a horizontal scroll bar is displayed for a particular hunk, the background color only extends as far as the width of the scroll viewer as opposed to the width of the content. The background color disappears as you scroll the content. This issue makes it hard to use the diff display for lines that are very long.
fields.summary: Diff viewer background color does not fill entire horizontal space

fields.description:
The diff highlighting only shows for the initial columns visible in the diff view. This can be seen by comparing the two attached screenshots. I would expect the highlighting to be on the entire line.

!diff1.PNG|thumbnail!

!diff1.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Diff highlighting only shows for initial visible columns

fields.description:
When I tried to commit a staged file, a dialog box will come up with user name populated, but asking for email address. After I enter it, nothing will happen. The file stays uncommitted. 

 

I tried to reinstall sourcetree but that didn't help.

Pull request is fine.

I also tried to follow instruction on some forum article to workaround by check/uncheck the "use global setting" box, that didn't help either.
fields.summary: Source Tree keeps asking for email address when commit

fields.description:
Jira won't let me select the version (v3.2.0.3360) so placing it here:

!image-2019-06-20-10-40-01-552.png!

 

Very exciting to see the dark theme finally in the wild. Hoping to share some initial concerns and observed quirks as they likely will prevent me from using the new dark theme.

Titlebar color has far too much contrast with theme base color, rips at the eyes, pulls attention and seems out of place with the rest of the theme:

!https://community.atlassian.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/57681i5A7F0223E8C00AE9/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999!

If your brand color is absolutely mandatory for the titlebar, it should be a shade or highlight that maintains the hue but is closer in contrast to the theme base color. 

 

Unthemed white panel is jarring:

!https://community.atlassian.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/57680i87F96984CCE36463/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999!

Unthemed text:
 !image-2019-06-20-10-37-06-940.png!
fields.summary: Issues with new dark theme

fields.description: Tabbing in Sourcetree gets stuck in the toolbar. It'd be great if we could allow tabbing to fully navigate from the toolbar to the sidebar + log view.
fields.summary: Tab From Toolbar to Sidebar + Log View
Git author doesn't apply global git author if attached a BitBucket account

fields.description:
{{}}

I always get this error when pushing to the remote if the commit includes LFS objects

 

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false --no-optional-locks commit -q -F C:\Users\shermes641\AppData\Local\Temp\ckmnkp41.bnt

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false --no-optional-locks -c lfs.customtransfer.bitbucket-media-api.path=git-lfs-bitbucket-media-api push -v --tags --set-upstream origin master:master
Pushing to https://shermes641@bitbucket.org/XXXX/XXX-ui.git
Uploading LFS objects: 0% (0/1), 8.7 MB | 107 KB/s 
Uploading LFS objects: 0% (0/1), 8.7 MB | 107 KB/s, done
EOF

error: failed to push some refs to 'https://shermes641@bitbucket.org/XXXX/XXXX-ui.git'
Completed with errors, see above.

 

Performing    "git push origin master" from the command line works.
fields.summary: LFS PUSH to Bitbucket fails with EOF error

fields.description: The "Nothing to commit" page is white instead of using the dark theme. See attachment.
fields.summary: Dark theme not working on "Nothing to commit" window.

fields.description: Dark theme is not applied to the "Nothing to commit" screen.  See attachment.
fields.summary: Dark theme not working on "Nothing to commit" window.

fields.description:
When calling  Sourcetree for cmd.exe / Process.Start() 
 * repo not open in Stree: new tab of the repo will be opened, but there is no name provided.
 * repo  already open is Stree: the call creates a new one with no name.

I guess, these two issues originates from the same problem (Checking tabs by name...?)

calling by:  [installpath\]SourceTree.exe -f [path to repo] log
fields.summary: Opening Repo from Process.Start/cmd.exe Tab-Naming issue

fields.description: Sourcetree use the name of each folder to set the tabs names in UI. Before 3.1.3 i setted a name for each repository and UI show the name that i set previously. Now, i can set a name, but, when i restart application, this name is replaced by folder name :(
fields.summary: Tab name not saved, showing folder name

fields.description:
Starting the installer it asks me to login to Bitbucket. 

I Login and then grant access to the application, It then redirects me back to localhost with the token but this fails. It gets to a "Page cannot be reached" and the installer is stuck.

 

sourcetree.log is included.
fields.summary: Localhost Redirect broken

fields.description:
**Steps to reproduce:**
 # Open [http://nibulon.com/data/zakupivlya-silgospprodukcii/kalkulyator-znizhok.html]
 # Choose a plan culture 

**Actual Result:** Incorrect data at the bottom of the form

*Expected Result:* Correct data in form
fields.summary: incorrect display of data

fields.description:
Sourcetree lists P4Merge as a merge tool available to use (under Options -> Diff).

 

However, after setting the merge tool to P4Merge, and then setting the merge command to the filepath for P4Merge.exe, I am still unable to resolve conflicts by using Context Menu -> Resolve Conflicts -> Launch External Merge Tool.  

The "Visual merge in progress" dialog opens for a moment, and the *Base, *Local *Remote etc. files are created for a moment, but then the dialog closes and the files disappear.   P4Merge never opens.

 

When setting the Merge Command for P4Merge under Options -> Diff, I've tried using both the full filepath of P4Merge.exe without double quotes and the full filepath of P4Merge.exe with double quotes, and neither work.
fields.summary: Merge tool does not launch

fields.description:
On attempting to install sourcetree, the error message ".Net framework version v4.7.1 is required"  is presented; along with a link that takes the user to the download area on microsoft to obtain the framework.

 

This all works well.

 

The problem is that for the latest installs of windows 10; they come with a version of .net that is greater than 4.7.1 now - and this prevents the installer for the framework from completing.  The only work around I've found so far is to use sourcetree version 1.9 that doesn't depend on this framework.
fields.summary: Unable to install due to .net requirements

fields.description:
When I double click on any repository, sometimes it opens and sometimes this repository go to root (does not open), if the repository is in the root in this case it opens.

One click instant send the repo to root.
fields.summary: Problem opened repos on Folders (Local repositories section)

fields.description:
Video attached as demonstration.
Account "Github - Https Saved Passwords" has an account https://api.github.com/ChristopherBass, which cannot be deleted, and when I set it as 'default', a duplicate entry is created instead (this process is repeatable to create extra duplicates)
These duplicates are deletable but the original remains stuck.

App_Data passwords file and userhosts file, neither contains this broken account.
fields.summary: Can't delete GitHub API account

fields.description: Through the History tab, modified files can be seen. Also, there is an option to copy the modified file path. However when I select multiple files that option goes to deactivate. I need an option to copy all selected file's paths.
fields.summary: Copy all file's paths to clipboard

fields.description:
SourceTree hangs when trying to restore the minimized window on my pc: no CPU usage, window stays invisible. This happens almost every time when activating SourceTree via the Windows taskbar. 

Workaround: It helps to not explicitly minimize SourceTree, keeping the window 'open' in the background while doing something else. In that case, SourceTree only hangs for a few seconds when being reactivated.

I have attached a minidump, I hope it helps.

Might be related to [SRCTREE-2039|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-2039]
fields.summary: SourceTree hangs when being activated

fields.description:
Repository names are not visible om some tabs after updating SourceTree through the internal updater to 3.1.3. On the first machine I thought it was just a glitch, on the second I found it weird and after it happened on all our machines I thought it's time to report...

 

See screenshot:

!image-2019-06-11-13-44-36-200.png!
fields.summary: Repository names missing on tabs after update to 3.1.3

fields.description:
[http://prntscr.com/o0bvub]

In russian version If the repository tab was opened when you exit the program, the title is not displayed the next time you start the program.
It appears if the tab is closed, the client is restarted, and the tab is opened again.
fields.summary: SourceTree 3.1.3 - No titles in tabs
Unusual unstaged vendor/bin executables, error during staging

fields.description: Would you please add a theme with dark colors? Working with the text based interface with a white background is not easy. A theme with dark colors, would make the interface much easier on the eyes.
fields.summary: Dark colored theme

fields.description: When sourcetree attempts to login, it tries multiple times.  If a password has changed, this can result in lock outs or security notifications.  It should try once and report the error to the user, allowing the user to respond to the error message.
fields.summary: Sourcetree attempts login 3 times

fields.description:
Open the source tree, and then add the repository path.

Then change the Name to customized one rather than auto generated repository name.

It will show the customized repository name in the tab, but when you restart the app, it will default to the auto generated repository name.
fields.summary: Custom repository name does not persit

fields.description:
Empty lines are randomly inserted in the output from custom actions. Rerunning the same action multiple times will result in empty lines at different locations in the output. The extent of the problem seems to depend on how fast the action generates output (if the output comes slowly one line at a time, the problem does not occur).

 

*Steps to reproduce*
 # Create a batch file test100.bat with this content:

{code:java}
@echo off
for /l %%i in (1, 1, 100) do (
    echo %%i
    for /l %%j in (1, 1, 10) do echo wait > nul
){code}

 # Add a custom action (Tools -> Options -> Custom Actions -> Add) with these parameters:
 ** Menu caption: test100
 ** Enable "Show full output" + "Run command silently", and disable "Open in a separate window"
 ** Script to run: test100.bat
 ** No parameters.
 # Run the action (Actions -> Custom Actions -> test100).

Sourcetree will now open a dialog box with the output from the script, which will be the numbers from 1 to 100 printed on separate lines interspersed with the strange empty lines. See the attached image showing part of the output.

If I increase the number of wait loop iterations from 10 to 1000 in the batch file above, the empty lines don't appear at all.
fields.summary: Random empty lines in custom action output

fields.description:
It will be convenient that providing fast click option, meaning when click pull/push, it does not popup window to select and confirm. It will be better just using current branch and pull/push when clicking the related button.

 

This can be an option setting in the settings, if it changes so much for users. But I really look forward to this convenient and fast click way
fields.summary: Option for no popup window when clicking pull or push

fields.description:
Clicking on the "Check out in Sourcetree" button on the Bitbucket web page shows an error message and blank URL Actions dialog.

!image-2019-06-07-11-15-31-323.png!

!image-2019-06-07-11-16-13-524.png!
fields.summary: Check out in Sourcetree from Bitbucket web page not working

fields.description:
I have two monitors attached to my Windows 10 computer.
SourceTree is running on one screen.

I am using a laptop, so I wanted to open my laptop, effectively adding a third screen.

What happens everytime I do this, is that SourceTree immediately crashes.

On my screen I now see a BugSplat window, WHICH DOES NOT  MENTION SourceTree. This leaves me guessing whre BugSplat comes from.

However this problem happens everytime I open my laptop screen, and I have noticed it is always SourceTree that has crashed. So going from two to three monitors will crash SourceTree.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes when adding an extra screen

fields.description:
Sourcetree is creating a new personal access token as often as every 2 minutes in Azure DevOps.

I assume it's doing this when it's checking for changes to the remote repo. I have _*thousands*_ of emails from Azure DevOps about a new token being created, and (obviously) thousands of tokens in on my security page in Azure Dev Ops.
fields.summary: Sourcetree connected to Azure DevOps is creating a new personal access token as often as every 2 minutes

fields.description:
When writing commit notes, sometimes you could accidentally commit by hitting the Enter key and thus you commit with incomplete notes. After committing, there is no way to edit or add to the commit notes, other than making a new commit with no changes and just updating the commit notes. 

If it could be an option to edit commit notes (perhaps only before pushing), then the commit notes will always be up to date and then you don't need to worry about accidentally committing too early while the commit notes are not done yet.
fields.summary: Edit Commit notes after commiting

fields.description:
Steps to repro
 * Have Firefox 67.0 as default browser.
 * Open installer, click Login to Bitbucket.
 * Firefox opens, displays following error...

 

"

Invalid redirect_uri

This integration is misconfigured. Contact the vendor for assistance.

"

 

Aside: Would like an alternative installation method that doesn't rely on browser playing nice.
fields.summary: Installer fails - Can't login

fields.description:
Going through the installer and hitting the second step where you need to register or login with existing Atlassian account, clicking Bitbucket produces the following error message after trying to go to the url below.

This effectively prevents installation from continuing and we are unable to continue using Sourcetree.

 

https://bitbucket.org/site/oauth2/authorize?response_type=code&client_id=HJdmKXV87DsmC9zSWB&state=authenticated&scope=account%20account:write%20team%20team:write%20repository%20repository:write%20repository:admin%20pullrequest%20pullrequest:write%20snippet%20snippet:write%20issue%20issue:write%20wiki%20email%20webhook%20project%20project:write&redirect_uri=http://localhost:34106/
fields.summary: Unable to register in installation process

fields.description:
It is very common use the left click and select "Add" an item to Staged area, but sometimes by error we click "Track file in Git LFS" and there is no a dialog to confirm, and then a lot of files are processed.

!image-2019-06-04-14-58-22-040.png|width=360,height=454!
fields.summary: Open a confirm dialog before add to git LFS

fields.description:
SourceTree spams error message windows with "'git status' failed with code 128" title.

How to reproduce:

1.  Clone remote repo with multiple files

2.  Send some commit back to origin

3.  Close repo tab in SourceTree

3.  Delete folder with repo using Ctrl + Del but not from Source Tree

4.  Spam will appear

 

IMHO, it could be better to check if the error has the same text and window already opened before sending another one
fields.summary: Error messsage spam

fields.description: SourceTree currently only uses the default diff.tool when performing an `External Diff` on a file. It would be very useful to be able to specify a particular difftool to be used, either manually (via a new command, like `Advanced External Diff...`), or preferably by configuring particular difftools by extension in the options (utilizing gitattributes if possible).
fields.summary: Specify Difftool by file extension or manual selection for External Diff

fields.description:
when doing a pull and the 'Rebase instead of Merge' is unchecked

Sourcetree still uses rebase to do the pull.

It should add '--no-rebase' to the git pull command

If I open a terminal and type 'git pull --no-rebase' it works correctly.

If in the terminal I type 'git pull' it will try to use the rebase.
fields.summary: Pull with 'Rebase instead of Merge' unchecked, still uses rebase

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At the moment Sourcetree only shows the author in the UI.

However, Git logs both author and committer. If you make a change and commit, you are both the author and committer. But if a developer cherry-picks a commit, the author is retained and the cherry-picking user will be recorded the committer. (The same is true for rebasing, or amending commits; by default authorship is retained and only the committer is updated.)
h3. Suggested Solution

Show both the author and the committer in the UI _when they are different_.
h3. Workaround

There is no current workaround for seeing this information in Sourcetree.
fields.summary: Show both author and committer information in Sourcetree

fields.summary: Error while pushing to bitbucket.org

fields.description:
There was an argument injection vulnerability in SourceTree for Windows in URI handlers. A remote, unauthenticated attacker was required to convince a user to interact with a crafted URL in order to exploit the vulnerability. With user interaction, an attacker could gained remote code execution on the target system by exploiting this issue.

Versions of Sourcetree for Windows starting with 0.5a before 3.1.3 are affected by this vulnerability. 

For additional details, see the full advisory: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SOURCETREEKB/Sourcetree+Security+Advisory+2019-06-05]
fields.summary: Remote code execution vulnerability for Sourcetree for Windows - CVE-2019-11582

fields.description:
_*Steps to reproduce:*_
 * Open the mobile application "Укрзалізниця"
 * in the dropdown list "Откуда:" select "Киев"
 * in the dropdown list "Куда:" select "Львів"
 * enter into "Дата" choose month, day "30 мая"
 * enter into "Время с" select "00:00"
 * Press "Поиск поездов" button
 * choose image "Бахмут 142П Львов"
 * in the dropdown list "Люкс/Купе" select "Купе"
 * selecting a place "34" in train
 * Press in the dropdown list up arrow
 * Press "Офорить"
 * enter into "Имя - Андрей"
 * enter into "Фамилия - Розовик"
 * check mark or cancel "services"
 * Press "В корзину" button
 * in the menu that appears "Корзина",we see unnecessary services that we want to cancel
 * Press "Back button"

+*Expected result:*+ menu-"Корзина"

+*Actual result:*+ main menu-"Выбрать направление: Откуда-куда; дата/время"

fields.description:
We have installed SourceTree for Windows ( v3.0.8) in Citrix Windows Server ( Windows 2012 R2) and published it to users.

Citrix users are facing an issue where he needs to Register the Source Tree again and again  whenever they are opening SourceTree application from Citrix. (attached is the screenshot of Registration windows). It seems the Registration info is not getting stored in Citrix Servers.

 

Contact Information:- Prasanta.barik@ah.nl; [nilave.chakraborty@ah.nl|mailto:nilave.chakraborty@ah.nl]
fields.summary: Source Tree - Citrix Server - Registration Issue

fields.description:
For recent SourceTree updates this fault has been "on again / off again". Right now (Version 3.1.3), using Beyond Compare as external diff tool is not working. I've tried all the usual tricks from Googling, but to no avail:
 # Drop the slashes from the arguments.
 # Select "Custom" external diff tool and manually specify path to Beyond Compare.
fields.summary: External diff (BeyondCompare) not working again

fields.description: Some times SourceTree get all available memory. It cause swap and entire system became unresponsive.
fields.summary: High memory consumption

fields.description: Bitbutcket Remote Repositories will show after fresh install of Sourcetree app on Windows 10, but stop showing after a day or so. Uninstalled and removed all Souretree related files and removed credentials in Windows Credential Manager. Re-installed and remote repos were visible then stopped showing after a while. Created groups with member permissions set to everyone can create repos, and everyone with admin privileges.
fields.summary: Remote Repositories for Bitbucket server not showing on SourceTree

fields.description:
Change Font in integrated diff to be something large 20+.

View modified file with line numbers that do not fit in line number column.

There are horizontal scrollbars which appear, however they don't do anything.

This makes larger font sizes in the integrated diff view impractical.

Ideally the scrollbar shouldn't be necessary and the diff view can calculate the necessary width of the column and resize it accordingly.
fields.summary: Horizontal Scroll for Diff line numbers column doesn't work

fields.description:
Click on a branch. Then click back on working copy. Try that a few times.

The main view is supposed to update respectively. For me, this update stops after just a few clicks and I always have to restart SourceTree.

Since the switch is kind of slow to begin with, I suspect it is crashing like crazy in the background. Also, this has been going for quite some time over many released versions.
fields.summary: Main view stop updating

fields.description: Just updated from SourceTree 2.5.5 to SourceTree 2.6.6.  After startup, SourceTree shows yellow flag that says "A newer version of Git-LFS is available"
fields.summary: Sourcetree flags Git-LFS as outdated, even though current version installed

fields.description: I am using an old version of SourceTree. I just downloaded the newest version and logged in using my Bitbucket credentials. Then it displays "OK". And then nothing happens.
fields.summary: Installer does not finish

fields.description: With SourceTree version 3.0.8, the external diff tool works only for the first selected file. All additional files display a "file not found" error message
fields.summary: File not found with external diff tool

fields.description: I'm not sure when this was added, but current ST always updates submodules when switching branches. As we have optional submodules that do not need to be initialized/updated, we always have to manually deinit them after switching branches in ST. This is *very* cumbersome, and colleagues regularly run into issues.
fields.summary: Option to NOT automatically update submodules

fields.description: As options in SourceTree, it would be useful to have greater access to the Git option set. Start with --allow-empty for the Git commit command.
fields.summary: Allow empty commits in Git
